contents: Senators who begin a filibuster usually want to stop a bill from passing. Bills can pass the Senate with a simple majority of 51 votes. However, it takes 60 votes to stop a filibuster and take a vote. Therefore, a filibuster makes a bill much more difficult to pass. Senators do not necessarily have to speak during the length of the filibuster. By invoking the rules of a filibuster, _____(2)_____ can change the number of necessary votes to 60.
